blocks.content: The Venus SW-6B is an ultra-portable 6-band CW QRP transceiver covering 80m, 40m, 30m, 20m, 17m, and 15m bands. Building on the SW-3B design, it offers expanded band coverage in a similarly compact package.
Power on by pressing the power button on the front panel. The LCD display shows frequency, VFO status, and signal indicators. Use the main tuning knob for frequency adjustment.
Band selection is performed using the dedicated band button. Each press cycles through the six available bands in sequence.
The radio supports dual VFO operation (VFO A/B) for split frequency work. Toggle between VFOs using the VFO button.
Connect a 50-ohm antenna with SWR below 2:1 for optimal performance. High SWR may trigger the protection circuit.
Access the menu system by pressing and holding the FUNC button. Navigate using the main tuning knob and confirm selections with a short press of FUNC.

blocks.name: CW Speed
blocks.description: Adjusts internal keyer speed from 5-40 WPM

blocks.name: Sidetone Frequency
blocks.description: Sets CW sidetone pitch from 400-800 Hz

blocks.name: Keyer Mode
blocks.description: Selects straight key, Iambic A, or Iambic B mode

blocks.name: Auto Power Off
blocks.description: Sets auto power off timer: OFF, 30, 60, 90 minutes

blocks.content: The SW-6B features a built-in iambic keyer supporting both Iambic A and Iambic B modes. Speed is adjustable from 5-40 WPM via the menu system.
Connect a paddle to the 3.5mm keyer jack on the side panel. The tip is for dit, ring is for dah, and sleeve is ground.
Straight key operation is also supported. Select 'Straight Key' mode in Menu 04 when using a straight key.
Sidetone frequency and volume can be adjusted independently. The sidetone is heard through the built-in speaker or connected headphones.
For paddle reversal (swap dit/dah), check if a paddle swap option is available in the extended menu settings.
The SW-6B uses a crystal filter for IF selectivity, providing effective CW bandwidth for weak signal work.
The receiver features good sensitivity suitable for QRP operations. AGC helps maintain consistent audio levels across varying signal strengths.
This compact radio prioritizes portability over advanced DSP features. For operation in crowded band conditions, careful tuning is required.
The SW-6B operates from an external DC power source of 9-14V. A 2.1mm DC jack is provided for power input (center positive).
Current consumption is approximately 30mA on receive and up to 1.5A during transmit at full power. A 3S LiPo battery pack is ideal for portable operation.
The radio includes low voltage protection that will reduce output power or shut down when battery voltage drops too low.
Do not exceed 14V input voltage. Overvoltage may damage the radio. Do not reverse polarity.
For extended portable operation, a 2000-3000mAh 3S LiPo provides several hours of operating time depending on duty cycle.
The SW-6B does not include an internal automatic antenna tuner. An external ATU is recommended when using antennas that may not present a 50-ohm load on all bands.
With six bands available, an ATU becomes more valuable for using a single multi-band antenna efficiently across the expanded frequency range.
For multi-band random wire antennas, a small portable ATU like the Elecraft T1 or LDG Z-11 Pro II works well with this radio.
No power: Check DC voltage (9-14V required). Verify polarity is correct (center positive). Check for blown fuse if applicable.
No RF output: Verify antenna is connected. Check SWR - high SWR may trigger protection. Ensure TX is not inhibited.
Keyer not working: Check paddle connections at 3.5mm jack. Verify keyer mode setting matches your paddle type. Try straight key mode to isolate the issue.
Weak receive signals: Check antenna connections. Verify band selection. Clean contacts if audio is scratchy.
Display issues: Adjust brightness in menu. Allow radio to warm up in cold conditions. LCD may be slow at very low temperatures.
